noun.description: The larva of an insect, especially a beetle.

examples: a popular bar serving excellent grub

verb.description: Dig or poke superficially at the earth; dig shallowly in soil.
examples: the damage done to pastures by badgers grubbing for worms

verb.description: Search for something in a clumsy and unmethodical manner; rummage.
examples: I began grubbing about in the wastepaper basket to find the envelope

verb.description: Do demeaning or humiliating work in order to achieve something.
examples: she has achieved material independence without having to grub for it
synonyms: work one's fingers to the bone
keep one's nose to the grindstone

origin: Middle English: perhaps related to Dutch grobbelen, also to grave.
